      • toVar

        public static java.lang.String toVar(byte[] arr)
        toVar method converts the input array (a0, a1, ...) to a monomial "b^(a0) c^(a1) d^(a2)...". The elements of the input array is the power of b, c, d,...,z. For example, if arr = [1, 3, -1, 14] then output is "b^1 c^3 e^(14)" (with space between each monomial). If the power is greater than nine then parenthesis will be added. Negative elements will be ignored. Only the first 25 elements will be used.
        Parameters:
        arr - A byte array
        Returns:
        The string of correponding monomial.
